Audio Learning Revolution http://www.learnoutloud.com/podcast en-us (c)2005 LearnOutLoud.com LearnOutLoud.com's "Audio Learning Revolution" podcast explores the world of audio books and audio learning resources in a wide variety of categories. The folks at LearnOutLoud.com have found the best audio programs, audio publishers, and prolific authors LearnOutLoud.com LearnOutLoud.com's "Audio Learning Revolution" podcast explores the world of audio books and audio learning resources in a wide variety of categories. The folks at LearnOutLoud.com have found the best audio programs, audio publishers, and prolific authors of great audio content in any given subject you want to learn about. The folks at LearnOutLoud.com have found the best audio programs, audio publishers, and prolific authors of great audio content in any given subject you want to learn about. http://www.learnoutloud.com/ LearnOutLoud.com Thurs, 20 Jul 2005 18:00:23 -0800 Fri, 11 Mar 2005 18:49:44 08:00:00 EST - (c)2005 LearnOutLoud.comlearnoutloud,com,learn,out,loud,com,audio,learning,audio,learning,revolution,learn,out,loudEducationseth@learnoutloud.comLearnOutLoud.comnolearnoutloud,com,learn,out,loud,com,audio,learning,audio,learning,revolution,learn,out,loudSubscribe with My Yahoo!Subscribe with NewsGatorSubscribe with My AOLSubscribe with BloglinesSubscribe with NetvibesSubscribe with GoogleSubscribe with Pageflakes The Portable Media Expo Education Panel David Bischke, Douglas Welch, Jeff McQuillan, Seth Anderson On Saturday September 29th, David and Seth had the pleasure of sitting down with Douglas Welch and Jeff McQuillan to discuss the role of education in the realm of podcasting. We now present this full conversation unedited.

They scour the religious scene far and wide in hopes of finding either biblical insight, meditational peace, or both. If you are interested in either religious practice, or if you're simply curious to hear what Johnny Cash sounds like when he describes the birth of Christ, than this is the podcast for you!
